children.name: keep out b1
children.definition: keep out to prevent sb from entering a place, for example bylockingdoors and windows, or building fences:không cho ai vào
examples: he bought a new security system to keep out intruders.
family members can go in to visit him, but we need to keep everyone else out.
keep sb out of sth
try to keep ed out of the bedroom while i finish wrapping his present.

children.name: lock out b2
children.definition: lock out to stop sb from entering a place bylockinga door: khóa cửa
examples: her husband threw her out of the trailer without shoes or clothes and locked her out.
lock sb out of sth
i can’t believe i locked myself out of the house again.

children.name: turn away x
children.definition: turn away torefuseto let sb into a place where apubliceventis happening, especially because it isfull: từ chối
examples: ▪ hundreds of disappointed fans were turned away at the gates.
▪ the club’s so popular, we have to turn people away every night.

children.name: shut out x
children.definition: shut out to shut a door, window etc in order to prevent sb from entering, especially because they would be interrupting you or annoying you:không cho vào
examples: shut out sb
▪ he slammed the door, shutting out the dogs.
shut sb out (of sth)
▪ john shut everybody out of the kitchen so that he could prepare his grand surprise.

children.name: refuse entry b1
children.definition: refuse entry to refuse to allow sb to enter a country or a public place:từ chối không cho vào
examples: refuse sb entry
immigration officials refused her entry because they thought she was planning to stay.
refuse entry to sb
the management reserves the right to refuse entry to anyone who is improperly dressed.

children.name: ban b2
children.definition: bar/ban to officially forbid sb from entering a building or area, especially because they have caused trouble or because it is dangerous for them to go there:cấm, không cho phép
examples: ▪ the tavern banned ted for starting a fight.
bar/ban sb from sth
▪ we’ve had to bar visitors from the garden because some of the pathways aren’t safe.
bar/ban sb for lifeforbidden from entering for the rest of your lifecấm vĩnh viễn
▪ after the incident at the country club, chuck was banned for life.

children.name: go in a2
children.definition: go invào trong
examples: it was getting cold, so we went in.
i looked through the window, but i didn't actually go in.
there was a man at the door trying to stop people from going in.
don’t go in my room - it’s a mess.
go into sth
make sure you wipe your feet before you go into the house.

children.name: enter a2
children.definition: enterformalto go or come into a room, building, or area:vào
examples: you need a ticket to enter.
the army entered the city from the north.
as soon as he entered the room, he knew there was something wrong.

children.name: come in a2
children.definition: come in if sb comes in, they enter a room or buildingthat you are in:bước vào
examples: that must be nina coming in right now.
as soon as adrian came in, everyone stopped talking.
why don’t you come in the house for a little while and get warmed up.
do you want to come in for a cup of tea?
come into sth
when you first come into the building, you’ll see the elevators just across the lobby.

children.name: make an entrance x
children.definition: make an entrance/ make your entrance to enter somewhere in a way that makes the people who are already there notice you:đi vào (thu hút sự chú ý)
examples: i waited until everybody was sitting quietly before making my entrance.
make a grand entrance
she walked slowly down the staircase, making a grand entrance.
entrance[cusually s] the act of entering a place or room, especially in a way that people notice:
bridgetmadea dramaticentranceinto the room.

children.name: breeze in x
children.definition: breeze in to enter a place confidently and calmly, especially when other people would be a little nervous or embarrassed to enter: khẽ bước vào
examples: katie breezes in at eleven o'clock each morning, two hours late.
breeze into sth
giles just breezed into the office, used the phone, and then breezed out again.

children.name: spoken: telling sb to come in
come in a2
children.definition: come inspoken say come in when you want sb to come into your room, home, or office:
examples: come in and sit down. i’ll be ready in a minute.
marge, it’s so good to see you! come in! come in!
‘come in,’ she said in answer to my second knock
hi, come in - lovely to see you!

children.name: ask sb in x
children.definition: ask s sb in/ invite sb in to ask sb if they want to come into your home:mời ai vào
examples: ▪ stella didn’t know whether to ask him in or not.
▪ a salesman came around this morning and i made the mistake of inviting him in.
ask sb in/invite sb in for
▪ she seemed so upset, i felt i had to ask her in for a cup of tea.

children.name: come on in a2
children.definition: come on inspoken say come on in when you want sb to come into your room, home, or office, especially when you want to be friendly and make the other person feel welcome:vào đi!
examples: ▪ hi! come on in! can i fix you something to drink?
▪ ‘mike, could i talk with you a minute?’ ‘sure, come on in.’

children.name: to enter swh quietly or secretly
sneak in c2
children.definition: sneak in to enter a place secretly, hoping that no one will notice you:lẻn vào
examples: when he was drunk he would sneak in late, hoping his wife was asleep.
sneak into sth
he had a passion for bebop and was sneaking into jazz clubs at age 14.
sneak sb inhelp sb else sneak ingiúp ai lẻn vào
we wanted to sneak my dad in, so my mom wouldn’t see.

children.name: slip in c2
children.definition: slip in to enter a place quietly and quickly without being noticed:lách vào
examples: maggie opened the door silently and slipped in.
slip into sth
a few latecomers had slipped into the room and were standing at the back of the audience.

children.name: to let sb enter a place
admit x
children.definition: admit to officially allow sb to enter a public place in order to watch a game, performance etc:chấp nhận, được vào
examples: children under 17 will not be admitted.
admit sb to sth
they refused to admit paul to the performance because of what he was wearing.
men will not be admitted to the restaurant without a tie. _each ticket admits one member and one guest.

children.name: to enter a place (illegally or using force)
force your way in u
children.definition: force your way in to enter a building or room by using force, especiallywhen sb is trying to stop you:dùng vũ lực xông vào
examples: they’ve blocked the door. we’ll have to force our way in.
force your way into sth
police eventually forced their way into the building and arrested the gunman.

children.name: break in b1
children.definition: break in to enter a building by using force, in order tostealsth:đột nhập
examples: if anyone tries to break in, the alarm will go off.
the burglars broke in through the kitchen window.
break into sth
thieves broke into the gallery and made off with paintings valued at over $2 million.
my car's been broken into twice this month.

children.name: enter a2
children.definition: enterxâm nhập
examples: a man was arrested for trying to enter the actress’s beverly hills home.
enter through/by etc
it appears the burglars entered through a back window.

children.name: get in b1
children.definition: get in to succeed in entering a room, building, or area which is locked or difficult to enter, especially by using force or by finding an unusual way in:vàođược
examples: how did you get in? i thought the door was locked.
some animals hadn’t gotten in the shed and made a mess.
get into sththieves had apparently got into the apartments by posing as electricians

children.name: gain entry b1
children.definition: gain entry/gain accessb1 if sb, especially criminals or the police gain entry or gain access, they succeed in entering a locked building or room, especially by using force: vào được, đột nhập được
examples: the police gained entry by smashing down the door.
gain entry/gain access to
somehow the woman had gained access to his dressing room and was waiting there when he came off the stage.

children.name: breaking and entering x
children.definition: breaking and entering the crime of entering a place illegally, especially with the intention of stealing something: tội xâm nhập bất hợp pháp
examples: you can’t just go into his apartment when he’s not there - that’s breaking and entering.
he was caught in the school at night and has been charged with breaking and entering.

children.name: trespass x
children.definition: trespass to illegally enter or be on sb’s land or in a building without permission from the owner:xâm phạm
examples: get out of the yard! can’t you see the sign? it says ‘no trespassing.’
trespass on
carlson was fined $1000 for trespassing on government property.
trespasser[c]kẻ xâm phạm
trespassers will be prosecuted.

children.name: penetrate x
children.definition: penetrate to enter an area that is well guarded or dangerous to enter - used especially in a military context:xâm nhập
examples: the barbed wire fences and security shields made the air base very difficult to penetrate.

children.name: to enter a place (difficult or long time)
gain admission b2
children.definition: gain admission formal to succeed in entering a place or being allowed to enter, especially when this is difficult or takes a long time:được phépvào
examples: brown gained admission by claiming to be a newspaper photographer.
gain admission to
we had to talk to several guards to gain admission to the courtyard.

children.name: get in b1
children.definition: get in tosucceedin entering a place, especially when this isdifficult or takes alongtime:vào được
examples: we queued in the rain for two hours and still didn’t get in.
you usually have to wait a while before you can get in the club.
they must have got in through the bathroom window.
get into sth
you shouldn’t have any trouble getting into the concert - they’ve only sold half the tickets.

children.name: burst in b2
children.definition: burst in tosuddenlyandnoisilyenter a room:xông vào, lao vào
examples: two men with guns burst in and told us to lie on the floor.
the side door of the pub flew open and three men burst in.
burst in on
i ran back to iris’s and burst in on polly who was ironing in the kitchen.
burst into sth
lotty burst into the room waving a letter in the air.

children.name: barge in x
children.definition: barge in to suddenly enter a room where you are not wanted, for example because you are interrupting sb:xông vào
examples: i was studying when ben suddenly barged in.
i wish he'd knock instead of just barging in.
barge in on
it’s impossible to concentrate when people keep barging in on you.
barge into sth
some of the strikers came barging into the meeting and demanded to speak with the directors.
